i.font: PAID SICK LEAVE AND EXPANDED FAMILY AND MEDICAL LEAVE
UNDER THE FAMILIES FIRST CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE ACT

p.style: text-align: justify; line-height: normal; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: .0001pt
text-align: justify; line-height: normal; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: .0001pt
text-align: justify; line-height: normal; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: .0001pt

margin: 0px 0px 6px; display: block; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;
p.u: Message from Superintendent of Schools Mike Thomas.

p.style: display: block; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px; font-style: italic; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; margin: 6px 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)

td.p: As you are aware, on Saturday, April 18, 2020, Governor DeSantis announced that distance learning will continue for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Dixie County schools will continue to provide instruction and assignments through paper packets and digital avenues. To help students without sufficient internet access, the district will be installing external hot spots at DCHS, RRMS, and OTES by early next week. The hot spots will allow students to download assignments while sitting in the parking lot of these schools. Students can finish work at home and return to campus when they are ready to upload completed assignments.

div.style: display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

p.i: In regards to prom and graduation, I realize how important these events are to students, families, and the community. At this time, my goal is to schedule both events; however, it is too early to make definite plans. I am also working with the Dixie Education Foundation, the FFA, and the athletic department to schedule their end-of-year events. In mid-May, the Governor and the Center for Disease Control should provide updates on when it will be safe to gather in large numbers. These important events will be scheduled as soon as possible.

div.p: I would like to thank our teachers, staff, students, parents, and community for being so patient and understanding during this pandemic. My thoughts and prayers are with each of you at this time.

b.a: Old Town Elementary School Walkway Cover Pole Barn

p.span:
The public may attend this meeting virtually through the Meeting Call-In Number. Members of the public wishing to address the Board shall email comments to the following email address,
publiccomment@dixie.k12.fl.us. All emails received two (2) hours prior to the scheduled meeting will be provided to School Board members in advance of the meeting.

p.style: font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)
p.font: The goal of Florida's EduData Portal is to increase the advancement of Florida students and schools by providing access to information that will facilitate important decisions about education in Florida. The links below provide access to interactive and standard reports in a variety of formats including graphs, tables, maps, custom reports, and spreadsheets based on your interests in education-related data.

p.style: font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)
p.font: The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 as amended by the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA), requires every state and district to publish report cards that show how the state, district, and schools are doing with regard to student achievement and success.

i.span: “Our schools will provide a quality learning environment by providing opportunities through educational planning and community partnerships that ensures student success.”

span.font: Under Florida Law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing.

The Dixie County School District shall not be held liable for any actions taken or omissions made from reliance on any information contained on the web site. The site was developed to provide interested individuals with the latest information about the school system. Great care is taken to ensure that correct and up-to-date information is posted within the site; however, the timeliness and accuracy of the information cannot be guaranteed.

The Dixie County School District shall not be held liable for any actions taken or omissions made from reliance on any information contained in the outside links included on the web site. These links to outside sites are provided as a convenience, but are not a part of the district's web site and are, therefore, not under the control of the school district. Although these sites are reviewed to ensure they contain appropriate content, the Dixie County School District is not responsible for the content or information contained within those sites.
